intro: Oedera multipunctata, commonly known as the spotted mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and white, fleshy berries. The plant derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized structures called haustoria. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Its unique ecological role makes it an important species in its native ecosystems.
